item.title: Is the chip sector having a meltdown? By this measure, it’s mostly just Nvidia.
item.description: Broadcom and Marvell shares have been hit recently. But Nvidia alone is responsible for about three quarters of the chip sector’s lost market cap in t...

item.title: The U.S. dollar is still the world’s currency — but maybe not for much longer
item.description: Concerns are rising about the sustainability of U.S. government debt and spending.

item.title: ‘I’m an endless honey pot’: My wife and I are in our 70s. We gave our son $40,000 for his L.A. wedding. Now he wants more.
item.description: “We have four sons. We financed three of them through college, so none of our kids have student loans.”

item.title: America’s job market is eerily similar to the 1990s dot-com boom — and, yes, it’s a worry
item.description: March 20 marks the 25th anniversary of the dot-com bust. Could it happen again?

item.title: My husband plans to leave his entire estate to his adult son, who steals his credit card to gamble online. What can I do?
item.description: “Dementia runs in my husband’s family. My husband’s son has been known to take money from his dad without permission.”
